content.div:
Taylor Swift would never, ever ruin someone's wedding. Really, now. She’s America’s Sweetheart -- not "the kind of girl who should be rudely barging in on a white veil occasion!"

What's that? She totally did exactly that in "Speak Now?" OK, OK, let's rephrase then: Taylor Swift would never, ever ruin someone's wedding by blowing up a boat -- sending the bridal party crashing into the water where they will curse her adorable name between mouthfuls of surf.

Huh. OK, so apparently that totally happened, too. We've even got video. (See below.)

But it was all for a good cause, everybody: the premiere of MTV's Punk'd.

The show that inexplicably boosted the popularity of Ashton Kutcher (and trucker hats) gets a reboot March 29, and Swift features in the first episode, where she'll be Punk'd by Justin Bieber, the show's first (of many) revolving celebrity hosts.

Now that we've got a video sneak-peek of the episode, it seems Swift -- "the sweetest girl ever," in Bieber's words -- is Punk'd when Biebz ropes her into setting off some fireworks for kicks and filmed-for-TV giggles.

Stuff explodes! And then, somehow, a wedding party falls out of their motor boat. A shot of Swift's trademarked "surprised face" follows.

"This is completely not OK!" Swift says in the video. "I'm going to a jail cell forever because you made me push a button!" she says in another promo.

We can only assume that moments later, Bieber or someone will pull on a Von Dutch shirt, exclaim "You got Punk'd!" -- and then everyone will hug and go for ice cream or watch a puppy parade or something.

As previously mentioned, Punk'd 2.0 will feature a new host every week. After Bieber, you can look for celeb pranksters including Miley Cyrus, Twilight's Kellan Lutz, Bam Margera, Hayden Panettiere and others.

Punk'd premieres March 29 on MTV.

Watch Swift get "Punk'd" by Bieber below:

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: Watch Taylor Swift's new video for "Ours," wherein everyone's favourite country-pop star plays an office drone. The work world, much like any Swift video, is a lot like high school.
link.title: Zach Gilford, Cat Videos Help Taylor Swift Make it Through the Work Day; She's Just Like Us!

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift's Speak Now World Tour is at its end. The country-pop star gave the first of two sold-out shows at New York's Madison Square Garden Nov. 21. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift at Madison Square Garden

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift always looks surprised in photos. But here's some news that really deserves an OMG-face: Swift was forced to cancel a series of concert dates due to bronchitis. Yikes! Get well soon, Swifty. It's time you built up your strength. Here, have a sandwich. In fact, have 10. We hope Swift's feeling better in time for her July 14 show in Montreal.
link.title: Gallery: Eat a Sandwich, Taylor Swift
